Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 8th overall pick, by West Texas in 1969...
Injured on 5/12/1970 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for one week...
Earned first career win on 4/3/1971...
Had first career hit on 4/8/1971, off Milton Menchaca (TRO)...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/3/1977 to a 5-year deal worth $6,890,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/23/1977, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1977, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Injured on 4/13/1979 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Won World Championship with Minnesota in 1979...
Hit first career homerun on 7/11/1980, off Forrest Brewer (SHP)...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 8/1/1981, going 4-2, 1.04...
Signed as a free agent by Penn on 2/14/1982 to a 1-year deal worth $6,250,000 per year...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 7/1/1982, going 4-0, 1.05...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 2/17/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $3,722,200 per year...
Injured on 8/15/1983 with a Inflamed Bicep Muscle, out for 2 weeks...
